messageBody:
Hi everyone!

I'm trying to pass dynamic parameters from my own TestCase's main(args[]) -
which calls the junit-TestRunner - over to my TestCase, and I just cannot
find any way to get it to work. It seems to be because of the RMI.
(sorry, maybe I'm just missing something important here...)

Scenario:

class Example extends TestCase {
static String sFilename="";

public static void main (String[] args) {
sFilename=args[0];
junit.swingui.TestRunner.run (Example.class);
}

public static Test suite() {
System.out.println ("sFilename = " + sFilename); // here now
sFilename from args[] has disappeared!
TestSuite suite=new TestSuite();
suite.addTest (new MyTestClass (sFilename));
return suite;
}
}

class MyTestClass extends TestCase {
public MyTestClass (String sFilename) {
super (sFilename);
}
}

What happens:
sFilename from args[] never arrives at MyTestClass constructor. Instead,
the default value of sFilename ("") gets there.

I'm really desparated about that because I'm trying to write a flexible
testsuite which shall be completely controlled by textfiles and command line
arguments.
I need to implement a large amount of similar testcases (for website
testing) that are processing all similar code but with different sets of
data and different sets of web page transitions, and I don't want to write
zillions of java classes to cover all testcases.

Regards,

Oliver
